title: How the Fukushima disaster forced Japan to adopt energy sufficiency ahead of its time
description: Two researchers have studied the solutions adopted by Japan to cope with the energy shortage that followed the Fukushima nuclear accident in 2011.

title: Profit decline for Facebook's Meta for a second consecutive quarter
description: Meta's disappointing results are the results of falling advertising sales as it faces competition from TikTok. They follow weak earnings reports from Google parent Alphabet Inc. and Microsoft.

title: Elon Musk visits Twitter HQ as $44B deal deadline looms
description: Elon Musk posted a video Wednesday showing him strolling into Twitter headquarters ahead of a Friday deadline to close his deal to buy the company.

title: French President Macron vows to implement contested pension reforms
description: The minimum retirement age to get full a pension would be gradually increased from 62 to 65 by 2031. Most opposition parties, as well as workers' unions, are against the pension changes.

title: Airbus profits from long-haul flights rebound
description: The French aircraft manufacturer could receive a historic order from Saudi Arabia, and exceed the threshold of 1,000 A350s on order.

title: Art is the new target of choice for climate activists
description: After Van Gogh's iconic Sunflowers was covered in soup, a Monet painting was splattered with mashed potato in moves intended to make the most of media attention.

title: Ukraine's power grid has become Russia's new 'battlefield'
description: After Russian strikes targeting key energy infrastructure in Ukraine, 'about 40% of the country's thermal electricity production is now out of service,' confirmed energy minister German Galushchenko.

title: 'It was the museum that was targeted when Sunflowers was sprayed with soup, not the work itself'
description: Activists who attacked Van Gogh's work referred to the slashing of a Velázquez by suffragette Mary Richardson, but art historian Bruno Nassim Aboudrar argues the meaning and scope are entirely different.

title: BNP Paribas warned to stop financing fossil fuels and 'climate chaos'
description: A number of NGOs that previously took the French government to court have now taken the first step toward a lawsuit against the bank, the world's leading financer of oil and gas majors.

title: Pierre Soulages, French artist who explored the depths of black, dies aged 102
description: Famous across the world, the artist who put darkness into dialogue with light also designed the celebrated stained glass windows at the Abbey in Conques, southern France. He died on October 26, aged 102.

title: Iran protesters mark 40 days since Mahsa Amini's death
description: In Shiite Islam, deaths are commemorated again 40 days later, and Ms. Amini's hometown saw crowds thronged at her grave.

title: Air pollution: European Commission proposes new standards less strict than the WHO's
description: Brussels is proposing to lower the exposure limit values for the main pollutants, without aligning with the thresholds set by the World Health Organization.

title: Putin oversees first Russian nuclear drill since invasion of Ukraine
description: Ballistic and cruise missiles were launched in the Far East and Arctic on Wednesday, the Kremlin said.

title: Qatar World Cup: Raphaël Varane doubtful among mounting woes for France
description: The defender will not play again for Manchester United before the World Cup, after injuring his hamstring.

title: As Rishi Sunak becomes prime minister, Indians celebrate 'one of our own'
description: The historic appointment of a British Indian prime minister also raised the question of whether India would accept a leader from a minority background.

title: Germany paves the way to legalizing cannabis, with some caveats
description: The German government plans to decriminalize cannabis, but before doing so they need to ensure the move is compatible with European Union law.

title: UK delays revealing new crunch budget
description: The new British government is supposed to present a new budget plan, after Liz Truss's  'mini-budget' precipitated her downfall.

title: Brazil presidential election: The battle for the key state of Minas Gerais
description: Since the return of democracy, no president has been elected without a majority in this politically-divided southeastern Brazilian state.

title: Giorgia Meloni sets a conservative course for the 'great Italian nation'
description: The new prime minister set out her plan for continuity in economic and international policies.

title: US midterms: Democrat Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez urges young voters to show up
description: The congresswoman visited California, where she urged UC Irvine students to vote in the midterm elections.

title: Rishi Sunak forms government, hoping to find stability amid disunity
description: There are 'difficult decisions' ahead, warned the new British prime minister on his first day.

title: Mercedes-Benz to sell off Russian assets to local investor
description: The Russian ministry of industry announced the German carmaker's assets would be sold to Avtodom.

title: The Paris return of Cyprien Gaillard, the prodigal son of French contemporary art
description: The artist, who has been living in Berlin since 2009, returns to the French capital with work related to Parisian heritage. This exhibition has two parts, at the Palais de Tokyo and Lafayette Anticipations.

title: Israel election: Bibi Netanyahu's all-out campaign to return to power
description: The former prime minister is counting on his ally, far-right politician Itamar Ben-Gvir, to convince non-voters and regain a majority in the November 1 legislative elections.

title: 'New York Times' contributor missing in DRC
description: A press organization said Congolese journalist Steve Wembi was missing after a raid by a government intelligence agency.

title: Germany authorizes Chinese company to take stake in Hamburg port
description: A Chinese company will take a 24.9% stake in the operator of Germany's biggest port.

title: Sky-watchers catch the last solar eclipse of 2022
description: Much of Europe and parts of Africa and Asia saw the moon take a piece of the sun during the second and last solar eclipse of the year on Tuesday.

title: Macron, Scholz to meet in Paris to calm rising tensions
description: The German chancellor and French president will meet in Paris on Tuesday in an attempt to repair damaged relations.

title: Fossil fuel dependence is putting global health at risk, warn scientists
description: Heat-related mortality has already increased by 68% between 2017 and 2021 when compared to 2000-2004, according to a study by a group of scientists for the 'Lancet'.

title: US Democrats retract letter to Biden calling for Ukraine ceasefire after backlash
description: A day after urging US President Joe Biden to seek diplomatic talks with Russia, a group of left-wing Democrats withdrew their letter after sparking intra-party backlash.

title: Canadian tribunal rejects indigenous children historic compensation deal
description: The plan did not meet all requirements for the victims of Canada’s discriminatory child welfare policies.

title: Six events to see at the Paris + art fair
description: The former FOACFrench fair provides a host of exhibitions, prizes dedicated to young artists and installations for all art lovers.

title: 'Fugitive: The Curious Case of Carlos Ghosn,' a documentary in the shape of a thriller
description: Ambition, money, glory... Lucy Blakstad's documentary looks back at the rise and fall of the former chairman and CEO of the Renault-Nissan Alliance, with the help of its protagonists.

title: Two French politicians under investigation for Russia-related corruption
description: The Paris prosecutor's office is investigating possible corruption and influence peddling in connection with the Franco-Russian Dialogue, an advocacy group presided by member of the European Parliament Thierry Mariani.

title: Italy: Giorgia Meloni's coalition gov­ernment wins required con­fi­dence vote by wide margin
description: The new Italian cabinet led by prime minister Giorgia Meloni easily won the confidence of the lower house of parliament on Tuesday, October 26, 2022.

title: EU search for energy prices consensus still fruitless
description: The European Commission had no new proposals to offer at the EU Energy Council meeting in Luxembourg on Tuesday, October 25.
